intro: Piper itayanum var. itayanum, commonly known as the Itaína pepper, is a tropical vine native to South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when mature, containing a spicy, pungent seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional use in local cuisines. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to both horticultural and ecological studies.
